text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the requirement of the Pre-Action Protocol for Intellectual Property Claims. In Section 6.1, it states: \"PAP for Trade\u00adMark In\u00adfringe\u00adment (UKIPO\u2019s \u201cIn\u00adtel\u00adlec\u00adtual Prop\u00aderty \u2013 Pre\u00adAc\u00adtion Pro\u00adto\u00adcol\u201d \u2013 Part\u00a02). You must send a Letter of Claim (essentially the C&D plus a formal claim schedule) and give the defendant 30 days to respond with a Defence and any counter\u00adclaim. Failure to comply can lead to a costs sanction (the court may order the non\u00adcom\u00adpli\u00adant party to pay a higher pro\u00adpor\u00adtion of costs).\" This directly advises compliance with the relevant protocol for smoother proceedings.", "criterion_id": "7be1c4f0-9de0-4816-8887-142072b36ba8"}
